name: Thomas Schreiber
background: Thomas Schreiber serves as Programme Director at ARD. Focus areas include overall editorial direction for ARD's factual output, seeking high-quality documentary and specialist factual content that explores important social, political, and cultural topics with depth.
thematic_priorities: Premium factual content that fulfills ARD's public service remit with journalistic excellence
Feature-length documentaries (45–90 minutes) with journalistic integrity
Investigative documentaries uncovering important social and political issues
Social documentaries reflecting diverse perspectives on contemporary German society
Character-driven documentary series that illuminate broader social issues
Historical documentaries connecting Germany's past to present issues
Science documentaries that make complex topics accessible to broad audiences
Cultural documentaries exploring German arts, music, and literature
format_specifications: Both series and one-off formats depending on story and slot
3–10 episodes for series, depending on strand
budget_parameters: Documentary: €150K–€300K per hour (higher for international co-productions); Specialist Factual: €120K–€280K per hour
technical_requirements: Broadcast/streaming standards; details provided upon commissioning
Varies by broadcaster/platform; align with public service/commercial remit
Subtitles/captions; audio description per broadcaster requirements
German and/or English; multilingual where applicable
current_calls: Reflect latest broadcaster priorities as outlined above ; commissioner-specific interests included.
submission_process: Clear indication of target ARD slot (e.g., “Dokumentarfilm,” “Die Story,” etc.)
Two-page treatment with premise, approach, and narrative structure
Submit via email to the relevant commissioning editor
additional_info: Submissions accepted year-round unless strand-specific; increasing focus on distinctive voices and cross-platform reach.
